metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1148 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the poolGrow function in expat/lib/xmlparse.c in expat before 2.1.0 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large number of crafted XML files that cause improperly-handled reallocation failures when expanding entities.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2012-1148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

libxmlrpc-c++8v5 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
libxmlrpc-core-c3 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
xmlrpc-api-utils - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
No subscription required

xotcl - 1.6.5-1.2
xotcl-shells - 1.6.5-1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15

criterions.comment: cadaver package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1').
libxmltok package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6').
xotcl package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-1.2').
